ygData.subject: Re: Langseax
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Aye.. that is exactly what ye do ta check yer faction... ... Tha faction ya need is a high amiable.  Jist use tha test mentioned above ta make sure ye
ygData.messageBody:
>From: "Rach" <emilystarr@...>
>Reply-To: EQCheats@onelist.com
>To: <EQCheats@onelist.com>
>Subject: [EQCheats] Langseax
>Date: Fri, 29 Oct 1999 09:04:20 -0700
>
>According to Everlore, here's how to check if you have enough
>faction:
>Note: An easy way to check your faction for this quest is to go to Renth
>and say "I will hunt the murderer." If he gives you more information about
>it, you have high enough faction to complete the quest. A great way to
>raise your faction is to give gnoll fangs to Lysbeth McNaff in sets of
>three. She is at the Pit of Doom.
>
>I believe that you need more than just amiable, but not so much that it's
>warmly, so somewhere inbetween the two.

Aye.. that is exactly what ye do ta check yer faction...

>>From: <Sean.Clark@...>
>>To: <EQCheats@onelist.com>
>>Sent: Friday, October 29, 1999 8:44 AM
>>Subject: [EQCheats] Jared: Why you have to be that way??
>>
>>Does anybody know what faction (amiable, warmly, etc) that you need with
>>the Halas merchants to perform the Langseax quests???
>>I spent about 3 hours running around Black Burrow the last couple of days,
>>killing anything that moved. It seems like one out of about 10 gnolls
>>drops a Gnoll Tooth (fang??). I've collected 38 of them...killed maybe
>>300 - 400 gnolls. Tedious...VERY tedious.
>>Anyway...I was going to try the Langseax quest next time I can get
>>together with my Druid friend (for tracking and SoW...heard this is useful
>>for following the dog during the quest)...but I was hoping somebody could
>>give me an idea of what faction will work so I'm not wasting (any more)
>>time.
>>Thanks!
>>Sean

Tha faction ya need is a "high" amiable. Jist use tha test mentioned above
ta make sure ye kin do it.

Arrrggghh! Ah wish Ah could ramember tha exact kind but Ah thin' it's "a
patrolling gnoll" that has tha teeth most of tha time. While Ah've looted
teeth/fangs from most everykind, Ah noticed tha patrolling gnolls seemed to
huv them more often than not. After Ah realized this Ah started huntin'
jist them. Found Ah didn' waste as much time after that.

Ah don' thin' trackin' is really needed (Ah've done tha quest more than a
dozen times an' never used a tracker) but a SoW is a MUST! That wolf sure
can run! It's almost as if he's got a SoW... err.. OK... he does huv one...
after all he is a Wolf :)

Also, when ye turn in tha teeth/fangs, ye don't HUV to turn them in 3 at a
time.. it's just that tha exp an' faction is given on every 3rd tooth/fang.
What Ah suggest ye do is turn them in 1 at a time until ye git tha
exp/faction. After that, start turnin' in 3 at a time. Reason why is if
someboady turned in an "extra" tooth/fang, ye only need ta turn in 2 more
fur tha exp/faction.

Lincus
E'ci
